Pacman.Model
Class GameCharacter

java.lang.Object
  Pacman.Model.GameCharacter
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Runnable, GameCharacterInterface
Direct Known Subclasses:
Ghost, Player
public abstract class GameCharacter
extends java.lang.Object
implements GameCharacterInterface, java.lang.Runnable, java.io.Serializable

This is the parent class for the Ghost and Player classes.

See Also:
Serialized Form

Field Summary
protected  boolean active
          flag, whether the character is currently active (mostly for the thread)
protected  Vector direction
          Vector that points in the direction of movement.
protected  Direction nextTurn
          when the user presses an arrow key or the ghost changes the direction, this variable will be set and the player will then turn in that direction at the next possible opportunity

          Vector of position of GameCharacter

Constant Field Values

stepSize

protected final double stepSize
This controls how much the position vector is displaced with each step the character takes.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

position

protected Vector position
Vector of position of GameCharacter

direction

protected Vector direction
Vector that points in the direction of movement. Should be normed!

active

protected boolean active
flag, whether the character is currently active (mostly for the thread)

speed

protected long speed
speed of the character. Used for sleep time in the thread

nextTurn

protected Direction nextTurn
when the user presses an arrow key or the ghost changes the direction, this variable will be set and the player will then turn in that direction at the next possible opportunity

thread

protected transient java.lang.Thread thread
Thread to compute movement. This way, the characters can start and stop themselves

Implementation of the run method for the Runnable interface.

run in interface java.lang.Runnable

step

abstract boolean step()
Performs a step in the direction of movement, if possible.

Returns:
Returns true if step is done, false if GameCharacter collides.

simulateStep

abstract boolean simulateStep(Vector position,
                              Vector newDirection)
Simulates as step in the given direction.

Note: When implementing, make sure the call of the step() method does not create infinite loop.

Parameters:
position - The position of the GameCharacter.
newDirection - The direction to go.
Returns:
true, if GameCharacter can do a step without colliding.

setDirection

void setDirection(Vector direction)
Setter for direction

Parameters:
direction - the direction to set

canTurn

boolean canTurn(Direction direction,
                GameCharacter sender)
Checks if the GameCharacter can turn into the given direction.
Calls simulateStep(Vector, Vector) method of sender.

Parameters:
direction - The direction to turn to.
sender - The GameCharacter that turns.
Returns:
true, if GameCharacter can turn.

turn

java.util.LinkedList<Vector> turn(Vector newPosition,
                                  Direction nextTurn)
Turns if possible and corrects the position of a GameCharacter to make sure, it moves along map grid.

Parameters:
newPosition - The position of the GameCharacter.
nextTurn - The next turn to do.
Returns:
LinkedList of Vectors
First element: the corrected position
Second element: The new direction of movement (as Vector).
Third element: The next turn (as Vector).

mapCollisionNextBlock

boolean mapCollisionNextBlock(Vector position,
                              Vector direction)
Checks if the GameCharacter collides with the next MapBlock in the given direction.

Parameters:
position - The position of the GameCharacter
direction - The direction of movement
Returns:
true, if GameCharacter collides

mapCollision

boolean mapCollision(Vector position)
Checks if the GameCharacter collides with the MapBlock at the given position.

Parameters:
position - The position if the GameCharacter
Returns:
true, if GameCharacter collides

setPosition

void setPosition(Vector target)
Sets position to target

Parameters:
target - Vector of new position

startCharacter

abstract void startCharacter()
This starts the character, which means the thread is started and the state changes

stop

abstract void stop()
This starts the character, which only means that the state changes, the thread continues to run.

die

abstract void die()
The character dies. This has different effects, whether the character is a ghost or the player.
